docs.title: Welcome🔗
docs.text:
Documentation for modifying the X30/X40 Toyota/Toyopet Mark II, Chaser, Cresta and Cressida. Also referred to as 'pig eyes' (豚目).

The motivation for this site is to document proven modifications. All data has been crowdsourced and references have been provided.

Thank you to all who have contributed. The site is being updated on a best effort basis. Please contact @ocampus for any additions, amendments or feedback 🙏

docs.title: Bulbs🔗
docs.text:
Changing colour

  • The stock cluster lighting areas are tinted green
  • Tint must be removed to independently alter colour

Key Information

  • Stock bulb base: 194/168 wedge (clear)
  • LED replacement: T10 wedge

docs.title: Engine swaps🔗
docs.text:
• wilbo666's Wiki page has always been the best resource for wiring diagrams and more
  • Pinouts and descriptions have been carefully procured
  • The site includes many popular Toyota engines such as:
    • 1JZ-GTE
    • 2JZ-GTE/GE
    • 1UZ-FE
    • 5M-GE
    • 6M-GE

docs.title: Japan🔗
docs.text:
Unique parts

  • Front and rear bumper metal overriders
  • Powered fender mirrors
  • 'Grande' grille badge
  • 'EFI' grille badge
  • Alternate grille also available
  • License plate garnish
  • 'Toyopet' boot trim
  • 'Corona Mark II' rear guard badges

Note: Grande trim pictured

Source: Goonet

Source: Jack Nyland

docs.title: North America🔗
docs.text:
Unique parts

  • Front and rear bumper plastic overriders
  • Park bench front and rear bumpers (different to Series 2 JP)
  • Rear license plate light
  • Side markers

Source: Meekzilla Paul

Note: Side moulding has been removed on this example

Source: Meekzilla Paul

docs.title: MX62 Cressida Series 2 (ADM)🔗
docs.text:
Quote

  • Direct bolt in to MX32
  • Gives you a cable instead of the linkage setup
  • Good for engine conversion or aftermarket carby

- Jordy Taylor

Source: Jordy Taylor

docs.title: MX83 Cressida🔗
docs.text:
Quote

MX83 pedal also works if you bend the pedal a touch

- Mitch Conroy

Quote

Yer mx83 can work also. But only one bolt hole can be used where cable goes through the firewall. pedal bolts up to firewall with both holes but pedal needs to be bent."

- Jordy Taylor

Source: Jordy Taylor

docs.text:
Quote

I put 1982 front and rear in a x3. Full bolt in. Only thing was the rear bottom was just slightly wider so it touched the doors just a little

- Michael Lorey

Quote

Test fit mx62 front and rear seats in a mx32 wreck I have. All bolt holes lined up with both passenger and drivers front seats.

- Jordy Taylor

Quote

Back seat hung on hooks, bolt holes lined up and base lined up with spring locks

- Jordy Taylor

docs.text:
Quote

  • I think i just had to drill 1 hole and spaced it up
  • Uses MX73 seat rails

- @johnnynomoney_

docs.title: Table of Contents🔗
docs.text:
• MX32 Cressida
  • MX73 Cressida
  • S13 Silvia (camber tops)

Requires welding

  • Stub axles must be cut from your existing shocks
  • Stub axles need to be welded to most coilover casings

Key Information

  • Lower bolt spacing: 90mm

docs.title: MX32 Cressida🔗
docs.text:
• Offered by TechnoToyTuning (T3)
  • Strut tower holes don't require modification
  • May come with stub axles pending stock
  • Custom spring rate available

docs.title: MX73 Cressida🔗
docs.text:
• Strut tower holes must be elongated
  • Camber adjustment will sit on a 45 degree angle
  • Requires a shorter spring or coilover casing to go super low

Source: @ocampus

docs.title: S13 Silvia (camber tops)🔗
docs.text:
• Strut tower holes must be elongated

Quote

We moved my top back, but that's X32 pattern with the holes drilled out. Should be able to just open up two of the holes bigger, or you can do all three.

- @dooogs73

Source: @dooogs73

  • Top OD: 134mm
  • Top ID: 108mm
  • Bottom OD: 109mm
  • Bottom ID: 85mm

docs.title: MX73 Cressida (rear)🔗

Quote

  • Spring does not completely fit on the perch but it works
  • Comfortable enough

- @ocampus

Quote

I cut more off the s14 low springs and fitted canter shocks. Its functional, not comfortable

- Josh Tomlinson

Source: Josh Tomlinson

Quote

R33 kings chopped a bit work well in the rear, surprisingly smooth

- Matthew Long

Source: Matthew Long

My springs front and rear are ra60 they go straight in. Rides fine for springs

- Matthew Sammut

Yeah I have ra60 king springs in the rear and it rides and sits fine

- @lozzz_3000

Source: @lozzz_3000

docs.title: Table of Contents🔗
docs.text:
• TechnoToyTuning (T3)

Warning

  • Factory lower control arms have bump stomps
  • Bump stops can be removed for more angle

Key Information

  • Bolt spacing: 90mm
  • Also known as front 'knuckles'

docs.title: TechnoToyTuning (T3)🔗
docs.text:
• Super evolved model
  • Fits 85mm, 87mm and 90mm strut casings
  • Sleeve included to adapt smaller ball joints
  • Suits aftermarket and factory outer tie rods
  • Adjustable ackerman
  • Adjustable 'steering reaction'

Note: Stock vs T3 pictured (factory bump stops)

Source: @ocampus

docs.title: Content🔗
docs.text:
• Tyres
  • Refurbishing Wheels

docs.title: Related Content🔗
docs.text: • Tyres

docs.title: Table of Contents🔗
docs.text:
• Guide by dooogs73
    • Preparation
    • Process
    • Result

docs.title: Guide by dooogs73🔗
docs.text:
Note: All images have been provided by dooogs73

Materials used

  • Various scouring pads (up to 1200 grit)
  • Polishing kit with buffing wheel
  • Drill
  • Liquid Reflection
  • Jack stands
  • Jack
  • Wheel chock

docs.title: Preparation🔗
docs.text:
• Ensure you have the materials specified above
  • Remove all hardware from your wheels
  • Put your car on jack stands (depending on drivetrain configuration)
  • Ensure your 'drive' wheels are off the ground

docs.title: Process🔗
docs.text:
• Remove existing wheels
  • Mount the wheel to be refurbished
  • Start the car and put it in gear so the wheels are freely spinning
  • Wet the lowest grit scouring pad

Quote

I think the soap pads/steel wool are a god send with water. Doesn't seem to be as slow as sanding/doesn't clog as fast

- @dooogs73

  • Polish the lip until you're happy
  • Move on to the next higher grit until 1200 grit
  • Turn off the car and remove the wheel

  • Attach the buffing wheel to your drill
  • Apply polish from kit and buff
  • Apply Liquid Reflection

docs.title: Related Content🔗
docs.text: • Refurbishing Wheels

docs.title: Table of Contents🔗
docs.text:
• Profiles
    • 14 inch

Key Information

Stock tyre size: 175/75r14

docs.title: Profiles🔗
docs.text:
Formula

Sidewall height (mm) = `( Tyre width * ( Tyre profile / 100 ) ) * 2`

Overall height (mm) = `Rim height (mm) + sidewall height`

_Example:_

_Sidewall height: (175 * (65/100)) * 2 = 227.5_

_Overall height: 355.6 + 227.5 = 583.1_
  • Tyre calculators are readily available online e.g. Will They Fit
  • Profile is important for when figuring out your desired ride height

docs.title: 14 inch🔗
docs.text:
